abstract: Sanford Weill, the retired chairman of Citigroup, recently told Bloomberg News that the bank’s enormousness isn’t a disadvantage. “Being large and having a strong balance sheet enables a company to withstand the financial turmoil that happens every now and then in global markets,” he said.

headline.main: Weill Says Big Is Beautiful; Hedge Fund Disagrees
